channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report X-2024030445
item.description:
Report X-2024030445

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a cart in the Hazmat cage facing down. No leakage was visible on the outside. Styrofoam shards were falling out. DescribePack: When inspected. 2 2.5 liter glass bottles were inside. There are slots for 6 but only 2 are indicated on packing list. Molded Styrofoam is broken. 1 of the 2 bottles had a slow drip coming from near the cap but was still mostly full. Small wet stains could be seen inside the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was contained in a Hazmat bag when found. Leakage was not visible on the outside.

item.title: Report X-2024030376
item.description:
Report X-2024030376

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet, contained in a plastic bag in QA damage area, then moved to Hazmat cage. DescribePack: 2 bottles of Paramount Super Concentrated Machine Dishwash were inside the package. No active leakage was found and both bottles were still mostly full but box and both bottles were soiled by the leakage. Test strip indicated a pH13 as SDS shows for this product. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote lined with Hazmat bags.

item.title: Report E-2024030182
item.description:
Report E-2024030182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LANDSTAR INWAY, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 5, 2024 at 1213 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Laredo, Texas regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons KEROPUR AP 205-20, UN1307 3, III from (1) 55-gallon DM. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release was caused by a puncture from a nail and was contained to a small area on the trailer floor and a 2’ x 2’ area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors were able to clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The damaged drum with product was placed in an 85-gallon overpack DM. All waste generated from addressing this release, was containerized in (1) 5-gallon poly drum, and (1) 85-gallon overpack DM, which was then staged onsite by the contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030166
item.description:
Report E-2024030166

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Dallas, TX; the spill consisted of approximately 1 gallon of C16 Racing Fuel (UN1203), which was released from a 2 gallon metal can due to a forklift puncture when loading. The terminal stated they cleaned the spill with Oil Dri prior to the call and placed the contents into a 5 gallon metal drum with plastic lining for disposal. The waste was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024030148
item.description:
Report E-2024030148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by a faulty pallet and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 95-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024030159
item.description:
Report E-2024030159

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 27, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged and released approximately eight (8) gallons of product to the trailer interior, asphalt, and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the dock floor, trailer interior and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. The residual product within the punctured tote was emptied and transferred to a new 330-gallon tote. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged tote was deconstructed with hand tools and placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both drums were staged on site

item.title: Report X-2024021929
item.description:
Report X-2024021929

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-08T18:13:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN MESQUITE, TEXAS AN AIR PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING AT THE DELIVERY DESTINATION. RESPONDER INSPECTED TO FIND ONE GALLON OF NMD 80 NEW MASONRY DETERGENT REGULATED IN TRANSPORTATION AS A CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE A DANEROUS GOODS WAS BEING SHIPPED. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
